ai-sn36:7.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

ai-sn36:7.1.2_1: where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-sn36:7.1.3_0: and told the mendicants what had happened.
ai-sn36:7.2.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant should wait mindful and aware.
ai-sn36:7.2.2_0: Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent!
ai-sn36:7.3.1_0: And how is a mendicant mindful?
ai-sn36:7.3.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn36:7.3.3_0: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings ...
ai-sn36:7.3.4_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-sn36:7.3.5_0: They meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-sn36:7.3.6_0: That’s how a mendicant is mindful.
ai-sn36:7.4.1_0: And how is a mendicant aware?
ai-sn36:7.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant acts with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-sn36:7.4.3_0: That’s how a mendicant acts with situational awareness.
ai-sn36:7.4.5_0: Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent!
ai-sn36:7.5.1_0: While a mendicant is meditating like this—mindful, aware, diligent, keen, and resolute—if pleasant feelings arise, they understand:
ai-sn36:7.5.2_0: ‘A pleasant feeling has arisen in me.
ai-sn36:7.5.6_0: But this body is impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated.
ai-sn36:7.5.7_0: So how could a pleasant feeling be permanent, since it has arisen dependent on a body that is impermanent, conditioned, and dependently originated?’
ai-sn36:7.5.8_0: They meditate observing impermanence, vanishing, dispassion, cessation, and letting go in the body and pleasant feeling.
ai-sn36:7.5.9_0: As they do so, they give up the underlying tendency for greed for the body and pleasant feeling.
ai-sn36:7.6.1_0: While a mendicant is meditating like this—mindful, aware, diligent, keen, and resolute—if painful feelings arise, they understand:
ai-sn36:7.6.3_0: ‘A painful feeling has arisen in me.

ai-sn36:7.6.8_0: So how could a painful feeling be permanent, since it has arisen dependent on a body that is impermanent, conditioned, and dependently originated?’
ai-sn36:7.6.9_0: They meditate observing impermanence, vanishing, dispassion, cessation, and letting go in the body and painful feeling.
ai-sn36:7.6.10_0: As they do so, they give rise to painful feelings.
ai-sn36:7.6.10_1: As they do so they give up the underlying tendency for repulsion towards the body and painful feeling.
ai-sn36:7.7.1_0: While a mendicant is meditating like this—mindful, aware, diligent, keen, and resolute—if neutral feelings arise, they understand:
ai-sn36:7.7.2_0: ‘A neutral feeling has arisen in me.

ai-sn36:7.7.7_0: So how could a neutral feeling be permanent, since it has arisen dependent on a body that is impermanent, conditioned, and dependently originated?’
ai-sn36:7.7.8_0: They meditate observing impermanence, vanishing, dispassion, cessation, and letting go in the body and neutral feeling.
ai-sn36:7.7.9_0: As they do so, they give rise to neutral feeling.
ai-sn36:7.7.9_1: As they do so, they give up the underlying tendency for ignorance towards the body and neutral feeling.

ai-sn36:7.9.4_0: They understand: ‘When my body breaks up and my life is over, everything that’s felt, being no longer relished, will become cool right here.’”

ai-sn36:9.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these three feelings are impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
ai-sn36:9.1.4_0: These are the three feelings that are impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.”
ai-sn36:10.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these three feelings are born, rooted, sourced, and conditioned by contact.
ai-sn36:10.1.4_0: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
ai-sn36:10.1.5_0: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, the corresponding pleasant feeling ceases and stops.
ai-sn36:10.1.6_0: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
ai-sn36:10.1.7_0: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as painful, the corresponding painful feeling ceases and stops.
ai-sn36:10.1.8_0: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
ai-sn36:10.1.9_0: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as neutral, the corresponding neutral feeling ceases and stops.
ai-sn36:10.1.10_0: When you rub two sticks together, heat is generated and fire is produced.
ai-sn36:10.1.10_1: But when you part the sticks and lay them aside, any corresponding heat ceases and stops.
ai-sn36:10.1.11_0: In the same way, these three feelings are born, rooted, sourced, and conditioned by contact.
ai-sn36:10.1.12_0: The appropriate feeling arises dependent on the corresponding contact.
ai-sn36:10.1.13_0: When the corresponding contact ceases, the appropriate feeling ceases.”
ai-sn36:10.1.15_0: The first sub-chapter on feeling is finished.

ai-sn36:15.1.9_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path ...
ai-sn36:15.1.10_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-sn36:15.1.11_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling ...
ai-sn36:15.1.12_0: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn36:15.1.13_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.

ai-sn36:22.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:22.0.3_0: 22. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:22.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you an exposition of the teaching on the hundred and eight.
ai-sn36:22.1.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
ai-sn36:22.1.3_0: And what is the exposition of the teaching on the hundred and eight?
ai-sn36:22.1.4_0: In one explanation I’ve spoken of two feelings. In another explanation I’ve spoken of three feelings, or five, six, eighteen, thirty-six, or a hundred and eight feelings.
ai-sn36:22.1.8_0: and I’ve spoken of three feelings.
ai-sn36:22.1.10_0: And I’ve spoken of eight feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.1_0: And what are the two feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.3_0: These are called the two feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.4_0: And what are the three feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.6_0: These are called the three feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.7_0: And what are the five feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.8_0: The faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity. ...
ai-sn36:22.2.9_0: These are called the five feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.10_0: And what are the six feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.11_0: Feeling born of eye contact ... ear contact ... nose contact ... tongue contact ... body contact ...
ai-sn36:22.2.13_0: These are called the six feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.14_0: And what are the eighteen feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.15_0: There are six preoccupations with happiness, six preoccupations with sadness, and six preocupations with equanimity. ...
ai-sn36:22.2.16_0: These are called the eighteen feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.17_0: And what are the thirty-six feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.18_0: Six kinds of lay happiness and six kinds of renunciate happiness. Six kinds of lay sadness and six kinds of renunciate sadness. Six kinds of lay equanimity and six kinds of renunciate equanimity. ...
ai-sn36:22.2.19_0: These are called the thirty-six feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.20_0: And what are the hundred and eight feelings?
ai-sn36:22.2.21_0: Thirty six feelings in the past, future, and present.
ai-sn36:22.2.22_0: These are called the hundred and eight feelings.
ai-sn36:22.2.23_0: This is the exposition of the teaching on the hundred and eight.”
ai-sn36:23.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:23.1.1_0: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
ai-sn36:23.1.2_0: “Sir, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the origin of feeling?
ai-sn36:23.1.3_0: What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feelings?
ai-sn36:23.1.4_0: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”
ai-sn36:23.2.5_0: Craving is the practice that leads to the origin of feeling.
ai-sn36:23.2.7_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path ...
ai-sn36:23.2.8_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-sn36:23.2.9_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.
ai-sn36:23.2.10_0: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
ai-sn36:23.2.11_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.”
ai-sn36:24.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:24.1.1_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
ai-sn36:24.1.2_0: ‘What is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?
ai-sn36:24.1.3_0: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?’
ai-sn36:24.1.9_0: Craving is the practice that leads to the origin of feeling ...
ai-sn36:24.1.10_0: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.’”
ai-sn36:25.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:25.1.1_0: “‘These are the feelings.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-sn36:25.1.3_0: ‘This is the practice that leads to the origin of feeling.’ ...
ai-sn36:25.1.5_0: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling.’ ...
ai-sn36:25.1.8_0: ‘This is the escape from.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.”

ai-sn36:27.1.4_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand these three feelings’ gratification, drawback, and escape.
ai-sn36:27.1.5_0: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-sn36:27.1.6_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand these three feelings’ gratification, drawback, and escape.
ai-sn36:27.1.7_0: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins.
ai-sn36:27.1.7_1: Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”

ai-sn36:28.1.5_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do understand ...”

ai-sn36:29.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t understand feeling, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation. ...
ai-sn36:29.1.2_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do understand ...”
ai-sn36:30.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:31.0.2_0: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
ai-sn36:31.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there is material rapture, spiritual rapture, and even more spiritual rapture.
ai-sn36:31.1.2_0: There is material pleasure, spiritual pleasure, and even more spiritual pleasure.
ai-sn36:31.1.3_0: There is material equanimity, spiritual equanimity, and even more spiritual equanimity.
ai-sn36:31.1.4_0: There is material liberation, spiritual liberation, and even more spiritual liberation.
ai-sn36:31.1.6_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.1.7_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn36:31.1.8_0: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing. ...
ai-sn36:31.1.9_0: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-sn36:31.1.10_0: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.1.11_0: The rapture that arises from these five kinds of sensual stimulation is called material rapture.
ai-sn36:31.2.2_0: Now, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn36:31.2.3_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-sn36:31.3.1_0: And what is even more spiritual rapture?
ai-sn36:31.3.2_0: When a mendicant who has ended the defilements reviews their mind free from greed, hate, and delusion, rapture arises. This is called even more spiritual rapture.
ai-sn36:31.4.2_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.4.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn36:31.4.4_0: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing. ...
ai-sn36:31.4.5_0: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-sn36:31.4.6_0: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.4.7_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from these five kinds of sensual stimulation is called material pleasure.
ai-sn36:31.5.2_0: Now, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn36:31.5.3_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-sn36:31.5.4_0: Through the fading away of joy, they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-sn36:31.5.4_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-sn36:31.6.1_0: And what is even more spiritual pleasure?
ai-sn36:31.6.2_0: When a mendicant who has ended the defilements reviews their mind free from greed, hate, and delusion, pleasure and happiness arises. This is called even more spiritual pleasure.
ai-sn36:31.7.2_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.7.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn36:31.7.4_0: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing. ...
ai-sn36:31.7.5_0: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-sn36:31.7.6_0: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-sn36:31.7.7_0: The equanimity that arises from these five kinds of sensual stimulation is called material equanimity.
ai-sn36:31.8.2_0: It’s when, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-sn36:31.9.1_0: And what is even more spiritual equanimity?
ai-sn36:31.9.2_0: When a mendicant who has ended the defilements reviews their mind free from greed, hate, and delusion, equanimity arises. This is called even more spiritual equanimity.
ai-sn36:31.10.2_0: Liberation connected with form is material.
ai-sn36:31.11.2_0: Liberation connected with the formless is spiritual.
ai-sn36:31.12.1_0: And what is even more spiritual liberation?
ai-sn36:31.12.2_0: When a mendicant who has ended the defilements reviews their mind free from greed, hate, and delusion, liberation arises. This is called even more spiritual liberation.”
ai-sn36:31.12.4_0: The third sub-chapter on the hundred and eight parts is finished.
ai-sn36:31.13.1_0: a mendicant who dwells like a lion
ai-sn36:31.13.5_0: The Linked Discourses on feeling are complete.
